data.title: Amelia Earhart's Letter to Husband From 1931 Suggests They Had Open Relationship
data.meta_description:
https://www.newsweek.com/michael-beschloss-tweet-amelia-earhart-letter-george-putnam-marriage-1602957

Very interesting article.  She was certainly a woman...
data.text:
https://www.newsweek.com/michael-be...earhart-letter-george-putnam-marriage-1602957

Very interesting article. She was certainly a woman ahead of her own time who lived life on ger own terms.

Did she live on her own terms?

My takeaway is that marriage was something she had no interest in yet she went through with it. To me that letter is a formal statement outlining their ways out of the marriage she didn't want.

Amelia Earhart

As I recall from several biographies, she never wanted to get married. She married him more as a business venture and because society “said” she should. So this letter makes it clear that while she was fond of him, there would be no surprises going into the marital agreement.
